instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 4V
threads.message:
Board has liquid damage here and there - came from another shop.
Is working, it see battery, works fine on battery but wonâ€™t charge it.
There is battery charging symbol.

Tested with genuine 85W charger, known good battery and DC IN.

Resistance between 17/18 and 27/28 on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is correct.
Resistance on <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52, <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 is correct.

<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> is correct as well.

Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> but still same issue.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without battery 3.9V-4.1V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery, no charger 10.55V (battery got around 30% of charge)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery and with charger 10.55V

<RESISTOR>R7112</RESISTOR> is fine and got good traces.

Any idea why PPBUS is only on 4V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 4V
threads.message: Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages (no battery, only charger); pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 4V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 4V
threads.message:
"9 = 0.67V"
Post exact ohm resistance measured directly between pins 27/28.

Replace <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 4V
threads.message:
"Post exact ohm resistance measured directly between pins 27/28." = 20.8 Ohm
"Replace <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>." solved the issue

Thank you very much for help :)
